alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 31 at 5:03AM AKDT until April 02 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until midnight Friday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds gusting to 45 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow. Significant drifting of the snow is likely. Cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
